author: Content Admin
title: South Americans in Europe
text:
South Americans in Europe
Alexis Sánchez (Chile): Whether it be for Chile or the 'Gunners', Alexis continues to score. The 'Boy Wonder' now has a six game scoring streak in all competitions. In the Arsenal victory away to Watford (0-3) Alexis scored the first goal. Arsenal now sit second in the Premier League, and the Chilean striker sits in second place with Sergio Aguero in the scoring charts.
Willian (Brazil): The Chelsea midfielder added an assist on the first goal in Chelsea's goal against Aston Villa (2-0). Willian was quick to steal the ball and dish off to Costa who scored into an empty net.
Claudio Bravo (Chile): His interventions in the second half helped Barcelona to avoid unnecessary troubles in their win against Rayo Vallecano.
Luis Suárez (Uruguay): Luis scored once and assisted on a Neymar goal in Barcelona's win.
Edinson Cavani (Uruguay): Situated on the left wing for PSG, Cavani fed Swedish striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic on one of his two goals in PSG's win over Bastia (0-2).
Felipe Caicedo (Ecuador): Caicedo scored in the victory of Espanyol against Real Betis (1-3), getting his third goal in the league while cementing himself as the go-to-guy after the departure of Uruguayan Stuani.
Carlos Bacca (Colombia): Coming off the bench soon after the start of the second half, the Colombian striker scored the goal that gave Milan a draw against Torino (1-1).
Text and Photo: AFP
Edition: conmebol.com
